issues.description: Strong clustering of scores in the low range (0.12-0.24), with mean at 0.24. Not enough mid-range scores.
issues.suggested_fix: Add explicit guidance about mid-range similarity cases and when to use scores between 0.3-0.7

issues.description: Similar Jaccard values getting different scores without clear justification
examples: Pairs with Jaccard ~0.2 receiving scores from 0.14-0.23
issues.suggested_fix: Add specific Jaccard similarity thresholds and corresponding score ranges to the prompt

issues.description: Inconsistent handling of contradictions between context deck counts and graph features
examples: Card_80181649-Card_81439173 mentions contradiction but doesn't affect scoring
issues.suggested_fix: Add guidance on how to handle and weight contradictory graph evidence

strengths: Excellent reasoning detail and structure across all annotations
Strong utilization of graph features in reasoning
Perfect completeness with all required fields
Good handling of edge cases (very high/low similarity)
Consistent reasoning structure with clear sections
feedback:
The annotations show strong attention to detail and excellent reasoning structure, but suffer from significant score clustering and consistency issues. While the full score range is technically used (0.12-0.97), there's a heavy bias toward low scores, with most falling below 0.3. The reasoning quality is high, with detailed analysis of graph features and clear justification structures, but the interpretation of similar graph features sometimes leads to different scores without clear justification.

The handling of high-similarity pairs (like the 0.97 example) is excellent, with detailed analysis of graph features and archetype context. However, the mid-range similarities are underrepresented, suggesting a tendency to push scores toward extremes.

The completeness and reasoning structure are particular strengths, with every annotation following a clear format and including all required information. The use of graph features is consistent and detailed, though the interpretation could be more standardized.

example_annotations.mid_range: Add example with 0.5 score showing partial functional overlap
example_annotations.contradictory_evidence: Add example showing how to weight different graph features

prompt_improvements: Include calibration examples at 0.3, 0.5, and 0.7 scores

recommendations: Establish clear score bands based on Jaccard similarity ranges
Add example annotations for mid-range similarity scores (0.4-0.6)
Create specific guidelines for handling contradictory graph evidence
Include more archetype-based reasoning for mid-range scores
Add calibration examples showing when to use each 0.1 score increment
